alert.note: Alert for Toombs (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 6:41PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Toombs County through 715 PM EDT... At 641 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Altamaha, or near Plant Hatch, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Toombs County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
